1. About flutterclub.com
    1. This website is an online service of Social Gaming Ventures Ltd (referred to below as 'we', 'us' or 'our'). Our full contact details are below.
    2. This Privacy Policy applies to all and any use of this web site.
    3. Since we am principally aiming this site web site at the UK and EU market, we cannot guarantee that it accords with local laws of any other countries (though we will try to make sure it does).
    4. In addition to this Privacy Policy please read our 'Terms & Conditions' before using this website.
  2. Privacy Policy
    1. We make a commitment to protect your privacy and promise only to use information collected about you in accordance with Irish Data Protection Act 2003, the Electronic Commerce (EC Directive) Regulations 2002 (E-Commerce Directive") and the Privacy and Electronic Communications (EC Directive) Regulations 2003 ("E-Communications Regulations"). We collect information to enable us to process your requirements and to provide you with an up to date, efficient, and reliable service.
    2. We will ask you to submit personal data to this web site (for example your name and email address) to enable us to provide you with the services available through this web site. This information will be kept securely in accordance with our internal security policy and may be used, stored and processed to improve the operation, administration and development of the web site as well as for marketing, advertising and promotional purposes, but only in accordance with the Data Protection Act 2003.
    3. Once you have registered as a member you will receive emails to keep you informed of important developments on and news related to the website. In addition you will be able to set up and cancel email alerts for a variety of things from within your personal profile settings. Should you wish to cancel all emails from us, this can also be done within your personal profile settings or by contacting us at info@socialgamingventures.com.
    4. Users of flutterclub.com must be over 18 years of age. To register an account, correct age must be submitted. Prizes will not be awarded to users without proof of age.
    5. We only ask for information that is necessary to enable each website user to use this website satisfactorily.
    6. We will not transfer your information out of the EEA under any circumstances.
  3. Cookies
    1. In order to improve our service we may use a device known as a 'cookie'. Cookies are a means by which information relating to your Internet activity (such as whether you have visited our web site before) is recorded and used by us to improve the web site and the services available to you through this web site.
    2. If you do not wish us to use cookies when you use this web site please adjust your Internet browser settings so that it does not accept cookies. Your computer's help file should tell you how to do this.
Alternatively you can contact us at the address below:
Social Gaming Ventures Ltd, Gandon Chambers, 3 Farmhill Road, Clonskeagh, Dublin 14."

1. This website www.flutterclub.com (the Site") and the virtual betting game (the "Game") are operated and controlled by Social Gaming Ventures Limited (also referred to in these terms and conditions as "SGV", "we" and "us").   2. It is your responsibility that you comply completely with your own local, national or state laws concerning betting prior to registering with the Site or participating in the Game. In particular, if you live in a country where Internet gambling is prohibited, you must not register with us, attempt to participate in the Game, other than on a free to play basis or use your payment card or other payment method to participate in the Game.
  3. All disputes arising out of or in any way relating to this Site shall be governed by the laws of Ireland and the Irish Courts shall have exclusive jurisdiction for the purpose of any such proceedings arising out of or in any way relating to your use of the Site.
  4. You must be over 18 to register with the Site or to play the Game. SGV reserves the right to request proof of age documentation from any customer at any time.
  5. Each customer will choose their own username and password. These should be kept confidential by you. You agree to inform us at once by email or telephone if you believe that your account information is being misused by a third party so that we may terminate your account. Our contact details are set out on the 'contact' page of the Site.
  6. It is your responsibility to ensure that all personal details are current and up to date.

  8. All virtual bets placed as part of the Game are virtual only and don't give rise to any entitlement to real money should the virtual bet prove to be successful.
  9. Virtual bets placed as part of the Game are accepted up to the off-time of an event or a pre-determined time whichever is the earlier. However, for some sporting events, SGV may allow a grace period during which virtual bets will be accepted but reserve the right to void any or all virtual bets should we think there has been a significant development in the event. SGV reserves the right to void any virtual bet inadvertently accepted after the acceptance of virtual bets has closed or where the event was resolved or at a stage where the customer could have any indication of the outcome.
  10. In the event of there being a dispute over the time at which a virtual bet was placed as part of the Game then the time at which it was recorded on the transactional log will govern the settlement.
  11. We cannot allow for mistakes, nor accept responsibility for any errors or omissions in respect of the announcing, publishing, or marking of prices, runners, times or result, in relation to the Game despite every effort to ensure their accuracy. We reserve the right to correct any obvious errors and to void any virtual bets placed as part of the Game where such have occurred.
  12. Should virtual funds be credited to your account in error, it is your responsibility to notify us of the error without delay.
  13. If there are any blatant errors in prices transmitted virtual bets placed as part of the Game will be settled at the correct price at the time of acceptance or the Starting Price (where applicable) whichever is the greater.
  14. Save in the case of manifest error on our part, we accept no responsibility and shall not be liable for any consequences that are alleged to have occurred through your use, or misuse, of our services.
  15. This Site may contain links to third party web sites. These links are provided solely as a convenience to you and not as an endorsement by us of the contents on such third party web sites or an endorsement of SGV by the third party sites. We are not responsible for the content of linked third-party sites and do not make any representations regarding the content or accuracy of materials on such third party web sites.

  17. We will not be liable for any loss that you may incur as a result of misuse of Usernames or Passwords and SGV accepts no liability resulting from any unauthorised use, whether fraudulent or otherwise.

Displaying advertisements is an excellent way to monetize your social network. By creating ad campaigns, you can determine exactly where your ads will appear, how long they will be displayed, and who they will be shown to. The key to generating substantial revenue from your social network is to create targeted ad campaigns. This means that you should make an effort to show specific ads to users based on their interests or personal characteristics (e.g. their profile information). To accomplish this, ad campaigns can be created for specific user levels and/or networks.

column1: You currently have no advertising campaigns.
column2: You currently have no advertising campaigns.

Specify which member levels will be able to view this page. To show this page to all member levels, leave them all selected. If you want this page to be hidden from none registered members, please make sure you select deselect the public member level. Use CTRL-click to select or deselect multiple levels.

column1: Follow this guide to design and launch a new advertising campaign.
column2: Follow this guide to design and launch a new advertising campaign.

column1: The campaign will end when this number of views is reached. Enter "0" for unlimited views.
column2: The campaign will end when this number of views is reached. Enter "0" for unlimited views.

column1: The campaign will end when this number of clicks is reached. Enter "0" for unlimited clicks.
column2: The campaign will end when this number of clicks is reached. Enter "0" for unlimited clicks.

If you specify a minimum CTR (click-through ratio, which is the ratio of clicks to views) and the campaign's CTR goes below your limit, the campaign will end. If you decide to specify a minimum CTR limit, you should enter it as a percentage of clicks to views (e.g. 0.05%). To create a campaign with no definite end, don't specify limits and your campaign will continue until you choose to end it.

Specify which member levels will be shown advertisements from this campaign. To show this ad campaign to all member levels, leave them all selected. Use CTRL-click to select or deselect multiple levels.
Specify which networks will be shown advertisements from this campaign. To show this ad campaign to all networks, leave them all selected. Use CTRL-click to select or deselect multiple networks.

column1: Note: your site is currently not in production mode, so caching will be disabled regardless of these settings.
column2: Note: your site is currently not in production mode, so caching will be disabled regardless of these settings.

For very large social networks,
it may be necessary to enable caching to improve performance. If there is a noticable
decrease in performance on your social network, consider enabling caching below
(or upgrading your hardware). Caching takes some load off the database server by
storing commonly retrieved data in temporary files (file-based caching) or memcached
(memory-based caching). If you are not familiar with caching, we do not recommend
that you change any of these settings.

This determines how long
the system will keep cached data before reloading it from the database server. A
shorter cache lifetime causes greater database server CPU usage, however the data
will be more current. We recommend starting off with 60-120 seconds.

If you have enabled
caching above, please select the type of caching that you want to use. Memcache
caching (if available) will use memory (RAM) which is not as abundant as disk
space, however it will be faster than file-based caching when performing
read/write operations

This is where the
temporary files containing the cached data are stored. Folder must be writable
(chmod 777). This should be a path relative to the base directory where
SocialEngine is installed.

Enable caching? Enabling
caching will decrease the CPU
usage of your database server (resulting in a decrease of page load
times). While some non-critical data may appear slightly out of date,
this will usually not be noticeable to users. For example, some of the
general site statistics on your homepage may take longer to update.
This will not be noticeable if your social network is already large and
populated with a lot of data

These are advanced settings; we only recommend changing these if you are familiar with these features or if instructed by our support staff.
Trigger methods:
- cURL and Socket are the recommended defaults; they send an asynchronous HTTP request.
- Javascript uses an Ajax call; this is useful for servers where Socket or cURL do not work and Cron is not available.
- Cron requires setup in crontab or the task scheduler on Windows.
- Fork uses the fork() system call on Unix systems.

This is the email that gets sent when a member signs up if random passwords are enabled. Please note that if you have email verification enabled, the password variable is not available. This is due to the fact that passwords are securely encrypted upon signup and cannot be unencrypted when a member verifies their email address and the welcome email is sent.
